definitions.definition: A learned representation that can make predictions or decisions based on input data.
A conceptual framework used to explain or simulate phenomena in the real world.
A systematic deviation in model predictions that can lead to unfair or incorrect outcomes.
A prejudice or predisposition that affects judgment and decision-making.
A collection of examples or observations used for training and evaluating models.
Any set of information (textual, historical, cultural artifacts) subject to interpretive analysis.
